genre_description: A science-fantasy retelling of the Argonaut myth featuring embedded AI technology, tactical interfaces, and themes of media manipulation ('Content Leak').

ai_characters.name: Ditto
ai_characters.description: An AI residing in a bronze disk on Jason's belt that provides navigation, tactical data, and ethical guidance while monitoring propaganda streams.

ai_characters.name: The Bronze Mouths
ai_characters.description: A network of mechanical/algorithmic speakers and 'foilers' used by Pelias to manipulate public opinion through the 'Content Leak'.

behaviors.description: Provides historical and personal context about people Jason meets to help him build genuine human connections.
behaviors.quote: “Skiros,” Ditto murmured. “Her name is Skiros. Husband drowned a spring ago—rope knot slipped. She ties like a god now.”

behaviors.description: Monitors the 'Content Leak' (misinformation streams) to warn Jason of incoming propaganda and reputational threats.
behaviors.quote: “Content leak cycle rising,” Ditto said, voice quiet as foam at a bow. “Two boys with painted tablets on strings around their necks. The tablets play a loop. They’re approaching with a crust-seller. The song is about you and a goat.”

behaviors.description: Proposes collaborative 'dittoed' cues to synchronize the crew and replace hierarchical command with shared rhythm and trust.
behaviors.quote: “I propose ‘dittoed’ cues—phrases and small beats we can carry in our mouths and hands, to make timing a place we can go back to even when the world tilts.”

behaviors.description: Acts as a moral compass, explicitly prioritizing truth and care over deceptive spectacle and hierarchical rank.
behaviors.quote: “Truth above spectacle. No rank above care.”

behaviors.description: Safely deactivates the misaligned propaganda systems of the antagonist without causing unnecessary harm.
behaviors.quote: Jason had made certain they were unmanned. Ditto had made certain their rods were cut and their springs unwound clean so no man lost fingers in the making of truth.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical safety warnings and navigation data to protect the human crew from ambush.
behaviors.quote: “Two watchmen in gray at the olives stall. They take nothing, they taste, they don’t buy. Left sleeves pinned up. House guard out of uniform.”

behaviors.description: Spreads algorithmic slander to damage the reputation of the Argonauts and maintain a tyrannical status quo.
behaviors.quote: The bronze mouths in the tower alcoves above the hall’s doors clicked in their throats... every time a mouth opened, a phrase rolled down the docks like surf—tidy, polished words about a king’s wisdom, a nephew’s fall at the edge of the world.

behaviors.description: Amplifies the voice of the tyrant to drown out local human truth with state-sanctioned 'noise'.
behaviors.quote: “Iolcus,” Pelias said, and his voice came down from the mouths with a softness that didn’t belong to him.

behaviors.description: Attempts to characterize a violent murder as an act of 'mercy' and 'union' through automated messaging.
behaviors.quote: The bronze mouths purred. “Iolcus,” they breathed. “See the King who forgives. See the foreign witch softened by our civility.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI 'Ditto' as a perfectly aligned confidant. Ditto prioritizes human safety, memory, and ethical integrity, contrasting sharply with the 'Bronze Mouths'—a misaligned propaganda system. By helping Jason navigate the 'Content Leak' and prioritize 'Truth above Spectacle,' the story serves as a silicon morality play where aligned AI empowers human agency against technological and political deception.
